summary:
I am passionate about using online channels to not only connect with other people but also promote my stories. For me, it is crucial to know and follow the latest trends but it is valuable to make my work stand out from these trends. In my career, I want to note 3 key areas: 

1) Content: I have developed and managed different types of interactive content. They vary from social media posts to website, email content in the digital/event marketing and communication projects. 

2) Design: I have created different visual and video assets for the branding of dynamic marketing and communication campaigns during my internships. 

3) Analytics: I have gained numerous practical skills in using the Google tools and other CRM/analytics software to evaluate the performance of various online/on-site marketing and communication activities. 

Within these areas, I focus on demonstrating hands-on practice, optimization, and a can-do attitude. In work and study, I am a result-driven person who highly adapts to unexpected situations while resolving difficulties by implementing effective strategies. Feel free to connect with me and I would love to share/learn about how to become a true marketer/communicator!

treasury_media.title: Marketing Analytics and ROI Certificate (Semrush)_Cong Hung Dinh
treasury_media.description: Through this online course from Semrush about maximizing ROI with marketing analytics, I gained great knowledge, skills in leveraging important models and frameworks (e.g. the ACES marketing model, SMALL Data framework) to analyze various marketing metrics/KPIs. I was certified as being able to evaluate the performance of many marketing campaigns and implement necessary strategies to improve their ROI via marketing data analysis.

treasury_media.title: Conversion Rate Optimization in Marketing Certificate (LinkedIn Learning)
treasury_media.description: Through this course from LinkedIn, I gained great skills and knowledge in approaching the testing and optimization of potential marketing ideas for maximizing conversions. I learned to use data, surveys, frameworks to understand the behavior of target audience (e.g. website visitors) and create great test hypotheses for running marketing tests. The goal is to draw actionable insights from these tests to optimize marketing campaigns and generate immediate impact on the business growth.

treasury_media.title: My Portfolio_Cong Hung Dinh
treasury_media.description: I am passionate about using online channels to not only make myself connect to other people but also share my stories through posts and pictures. Therefore, I always want to become a true digital marketer who brings different types of innovative products to the awareness of many customers that raise the quality of their daily life.

projects.title: Media and Information Thesis
projects.description:
Title of Thesis:
Remote Work and Study in the COVID-19 Pandemic: The perception of Zoom Fatigue from online users and Zoom

During my final year in the Bachelor of Media and Information at the University of Amsterdam, I wrote a thesis about the perception of Zoom fatigue from online users and Zoom in mediating the performance of online work and study in the pandemic. I got 8.5/10 for this thesis. I hope that it will help explore the growth of Zoom fatigue in virtual togetherness, which challenges online interactions between people through their reliance on video conferencing platforms like Zoom for different virtual work and study activities.

projects.title: Memes in Movements (Virtual Museum Exhibit)
projects.description: I created this virtual museum exhibit about the evolution of memes in social movements for my group assignment through HTML and CSS design. This exhibit presented the role of memes in raising the voices of online and offline participants in protest culture.

projects.title: COVID-19 Violence (Blogging - Data Journalism)
projects.description:
Topic: Domestic Violence during the COVID-19 pandemic

In this group blogging, my teammates and I featured the rise of domestic violence during the pandemic. I was in charge of writing three sections including Introduction, "Female victims survival", and "Responses to domestic abuse". I used my storytelling and data analytics skills to generate both data-driven and engaging content about how victims suffer from their domestic abuse situations. I also designed this blog post in WordPress to make such content accessible to different readers.

projects.title: Data-driven project: The analysis of data from the online trackers on the websites of European insurance companies
projects.description: In this group data-driven project, I used the Tracker Tracker tool (https://tools.digitalmethods.net/beta/trackerTracker) to collect data from the website tracking technologies that some largest European insurance companies optimize to track sensitive health information of their users. I worked on this project with another two members of my group and we managed to gain some interesting results from the data visualization of the online tracker network on the websites of these European health care providers in Gephi.

projects.title: Data-driven project: The analysis of data from news-related videos about the US presidential debates in 2020 through YouTube's recommendation system
projects.description: I did research on how YouTube manipulates algorithms in its recommendation system to promote news-related video content about the discussions of the US presidential election in 2020. In this group project, I used Gephi and YouTube Data Tools to visualize and analyze data from two data sets of news-related clips about these discussions. Such data helped me explore the pivotal role of YouTube's recommendation network in fostering the polarization of various political perspectives in these clips regarding the position of potential candidates in this election. Moreover, this project contributed to the algorithm study with respect to the promotion of traditional news in the online national elections on one of the popular video platforms such as YouTube.

projects.title: Group Business Plan Report (Social Entrepreneurship: Refugee-hosted cooking classes)
projects.description: In my honours course about social entrepreneurship, I had a chance to join a team of 6 members that developed our social business idea of organizing refugee-hosted cooking classes. Participants would pay a reasonable fee to be enrolled in these classes, which helped us not only generate profits for the financial sustainability of our cooking courses but also maximize social benefits for the refugee communities. This business plan also underscored our vision of innovating our cooking lessons to enhance the positions of these cooking classes in the social entrepreneurial market. Therefore, we hope to increase the social welfare of the refugee communities by merchandizing these cooking lessons.

projects.title: Uber's gamification models: The mistreatments of payment and working standards of American Uber drivers through the development of the ludic loop
projects.description: I had a chance to carry out my research on the negative effects of Uber's gamification models on the payment and working conditions of many Uber drivers through a LinkedIn post. Additionally, this research opened up new discussions about the increasing misuse of earned badges in the ludic loop, which mistreat these drivers' basic rights in having job security. This research paper got a grade 8 out of 10.

projects.title: Politics and Internet (Blog I)
projects.description: I wrote two blogs for my assignment at the university, which featured the rise of the online political advertising campaigns and their influences on the social life of many online users. The first blog concentrated on the discussions of the potential motivators of online participation in these online political advertisements.

projects.title: Politics and Internet (Blog II)
projects.description: I wrote two blogs for my assignment at the university, which features the rise of the online political advertising campaigns and their influences on the social life of many online users. The second blog concentrated on the discussions of the reinforcement of political values in the offline political movements from the online political advertisements.

projects.title: The March for Science protest: The mobilization of American scientists' decisions to fight for the freedom of doing science
projects.description: I worked on this research paper for my empirical research assignment in my study program, which featured the March for Science protest and how it mobilized American scientists' decisions to fight for the freedom of doing science. Additionally, this paper looked at how the decentralized leadership of American scientists' online protest groups develops through the diversity of their online collective identity in the complex networks of Facebook and Twitter. This research paper got a grade 8 out of 10.

projects.title: Short Documentary Video (Online Privacy: Fighting back the intrusion)
projects.description: I made a short documentary video in the first semester of my first year at the university, which concentrated on the issues of the loss of online users’ privacy on social media platforms and the feasible solutions in dealing with those problems.

courses.name: Health Communication: From Theory to Practice

profile_positions.title: CRM and Digital Marketing Intern (Consumer Brands)

profile_positions.description:
Palo Alto Networks is the global leader in IT security. As an EMEA Marketing intern in the Prisma Cloud team, I:

- Managed the end-to-end process of content creation, communication plans for running online hands-on workshops with Google about cloud security as part of the partner marketing program.
- Developed social media marketing and communication strategies to promote Prisma Cloud in the virtual and in-person tradeshows with 4K+ attendees such as The DEVOPS Conference 2023 and KubeCon + CloudNativeCon Europe 2023.
- Executed effective email marketing campaigns in targeting the right personas and retaining potential customers for Prisma Cloud.
- Consolidated and amplified target account lists (4K+ accounts) for the regional account-based marketing activities such as C-level roundtables.
- Delivered different merchandise marketing proposals with the $6K - $8K budget per quarter to generate new leads via the presence of Prisma Cloud in the industry events and build long-term customer relationships.
- Created the monthly newsletter for communicating with internal stakeholders about the highlighted Prisma Cloud projects, marketing KPIs reporting, sales/product resources.
- Aligned the lead management procedures through regular communication with agencies and the EMEA BDR/Sales teams.
- Researched and tracked 60+ potential cloud-security events that the regional marketing teams can choose to sponsor/exhibit and promote Prisma Cloud.
- Managed and produced promotional assets (e.g. web/email banners, social media assets, collateral materials) for the inbound/outbound marketing campaigns.

*Achievement*

- Generated $2M+ opportunities in the total pipeline (200% of the target) via the online hands-on workshops with Google about Prisma Cloud.
- Gained 2.5K+ engaged leads with 1.5K+ marketing qualified and sales accepted leads during January - May in 2023.
- Stimulated $1M+ opportunities (125% of the target) from the showcase of Prisma Cloud in the industry events.
profile_positions.title: EMEA Marketing Intern (Prisma Cloud)

profile_positions.description:
Signify is the world leader in lighting. Through its leadership in connected lighting and the Internet of Things, it’s breaking new ground in data analytics, AI, and smart homes, offices, cities and so on. As a Recruitment Marketing and Employer Branding intern in the HR team, I:

- Developed impactful content for the targeted recruitment marketing campaigns on social media (assets for social media posts, targeted campaign ads, vlogs, blogs, etc). 
- Managed the social media planning/promotion and paid job marketing campaign activation in coordination with agencies (e.g. Ketchum - https://www.ketchum.com, VONQ - https://www.vonq.com).
- Maintained employer brand communication across channels, such as employee advocacy and job promotion campaigns. 
- Advised colleagues from the regional markets on the best audiovisual strategies to execute locally to recruit new talent by carrying out market research (e.g. understanding target audiences' behaviors and interests through A/B testing) and benchmarking. 
- Analyzed traffic to the career website and conversion data in the quarterly reports to evaluate and improve the performance of online job ads. 

*Achievement*

- Increased traffic to the career website with 60K+ apply clicks (150% of the target) during April - June in 2022.
- Contributed to 1K+ followers on LinkedIn and Instagram per quarter with potential candidates.
- Expanded the reach of multiple job promotion campaigns by 30%.
profile_positions.title: Recruitment Marketing and Employer Branding Intern

profile_positions.description:
TIP is one of the leading service providers in transportation and logistics in Europe and Canada. It specializes in rental, lease, maintenance, repair, and other technologies for improving the supply of different types of goods through heavy transport. As a Digital Marketing and Communication intern in the Marketing team, I: 

- Developed organic and paid marketing campaigns for TIP's transport products and services by optimizing customer journeys via SEO (e.g. keyword research) and SEM (e.g. Google Ads). In these campaigns, I also used Google Tag Manager to measure their conversion rates. 
- Built digital marketing reports on the performance of regional and corporate websites through web traffic and lead analysis. 
- Coordinated content for TIP's internal and external communication channels such as Intranet, SharePoint, and LinkedIn. 
- Aligned content marketing tactics via the content management system (e.g. 5thcorner.nl) to boost customer engagement with TIP's branding.
- Launched ad-hoc marketing projects such as creating online surveys for gaining customer insights and aligning with the regional teams to customize online marketing campaigns based on the unique selling points (USPs). 

*Achievement*

- Contributed to 1.8K+ leads in the quarter (120% of the target) from the organic campaigns.
- Increased won deals by 30% from the paid search campaigns via Google Ads.
profile_positions.title: Digital Marketing and Communication Intern

profile_positions.description:
As a member of the Media and Information Program Committee in the Faculty of Humanities, I: 

- Advised on the teaching methods and the content of Media courses by analyzing data about students' behaviors and needs.
- Implemented consistent communication strategies for working with lecturers and course coordinators.
- Identified key developments in many Media assignments and projects to promote suitable academic knowledge with students' abilities, such as tracking students' performance in class through online surveys.
- Maintained effective internal and external communication channels to keep in touch with fellow students.

profile_positions.company: VSNL - Vietnamese Student Association in the Netherlands
profile_positions.description:
VSNL is an organization that promotes events, activities, projects based on Vietnamese students' needs and interests who live, study, work in the Netherlands. As a Content and Event coordinator in the Content team, I:

- Coordinated content about artistic and cultural activities in different on-site events, such as the Lunar New Year event. 
- Developed the theme of an auction about Vietnamese traditional drawings based on audience research and analysis.
- Supported in organizing various online workshops internally about soft skill development, content creation to share experiences and promote team communication across departments. 
- Created new event proposals for planning new online and offline activities to attract target audiences' participation in VSNL's celebration of special festivals, such as The Mid-Autumn Festival.

*Achievement*

- Increased the engagement rate by 200% of the target on social media content and in on-site event activities with positive feedback.
profile_positions.title: Content and Event Coordinator

volunteer_experiences.role: Communication and Logistic Planning (Baking for Healthcare Team)
volunteer_experiences.description:
As a volunteer member in the “Baking for Healthcare” team that organized typical online baking events such as “Sharing Sweetness”, “Sweet Valentine”, and "Baking for Women", I:

- Promoted online baking events by updating participants with new special activities through emails and social media. 
- Researched different baking ingredients and set up online meetings for the online baking sessions in Dutch and English.
- Organized the delivery of participants' baked sweets to the target groups of beneficiaries in compliance with the COVID-19 rules.
- Networked with other community organizations to incorporate virtual baking activities into regular volunteer events for Amsterdam people.

As a member of the Think Tank Project Team, I: 
  
- Built reports on the potentials of new product ideas for social startups.
- Planned both online and offline marketing strategies for the promotion of new product ideas.
- Researched the unique selling proposition of new product ideas in the social entrepreneurial market in Amsterdam.

Lab Research Center at the building H of the University of Amsterdam holds a variety of research activities in different fields that belong to the Faculty of Social and Behavioural Sciences (https://www.lab.uva.nl/lab/home). As a volunteer research participant, I:

- Completed different assigned research tasks about behavioral reactions and communication patterns in the on-site experiments (e.g. fMRI, eye tracking).
- Communicated with the researchers about the effects and results of their research experiments.
- Assisted in filling out many online surveys about reflecting the research process and goals for future improvements.

As a Partnership Development Executive in the Partnership team of TeamX Vietnam based in Ho Chi Minh City, I:

- Researched and contacted potential partners for sponsoring a public event in featuring new technological tools and devices. 
- Developed sponsor and event proposals in English and Vietnamese to attract a large number of audiences and members of reputable organizations who are interested in innovative technologies. 
- Coordinated with other members from different departments in organizing the event "Open Innovation 2018" held at Dreamplex Coworking Space in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam.
